Since OP is equal to the radius of the circle(r) and as Q lies outside the circle so it is always greater than (r)
hence, \(OQ>r\) \(\Rightarrow OQ>OP\)
It is given that XY is a tangent to the circle
\(\Rightarrow \)it will touch the circle only at point P
therefore OP is the shortest distance between point Oand line XY
\(\Rightarrow \) OP is perpendicular to XY
